item.title: Report E-2024080000
item.description:
Report E-2024080000

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-09T00:38:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-13
  • City: Douglasville
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Spirit Express LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 193756
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver was traveling approximately 65 MPH westbound on I-20. He was traveling in the far right lane, when he fell asleep at the wheel. He awoke to stopped traffic in front of him without enough time to come to a safe stop. The driver jerked the wheel to the right to avoid contact with the vehicles in front of him and left the road way. He overturned on a side embankment at MM-43. Upon impact of the crash, a weld in the tank ruptured as well as one of the manhole covers on the top of the trailer. The product slowly leaked out of the trailer for approximately 1 hour. Other vehicles in traffic that witnessed the incident dialed 911. The driver contacted his employer, who in turn contacted Marion Environmental who was closer to the scene and could mitigate the release of gasoline quicker and more efficiently than the carrier could themselves. They set up absorbent booms to control the spilled product. The remainder of the product was pumped over into another trailer and safely transported to the original destination.

item.title: Report E-2024080096
item.description:
Report E-2024080096

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-08T15:13:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-02
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: USPS VOLUME AT RFD GATEWAY WAS FOUND TO CONTAIN ONE PACKAGE WITH LEAKING UNDECLARED DANGEROUS GOODS AEROSOL CONTENTS. OUTER PACKAGE INSPECTION REVEALS ONE USPS PRIORITY MAIL BOX THAT HAS BEEN PARTIALLY DESTROYED WITH FOUR AEROSOL CANS OF SPRAYWAY GLASS CLEANER SPILLING OUT. INITIAL REVIEW REVEALS ONE OF THE AEROSOL CANS LEAKED CONTENTS CAUSING THE PACKAGE TO DETERIORATE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER USPS BOX. THE BOX DOES NOT HAVE SHIPPER OR CONSIGNEE INFORMATION. PRIOR TO THE UNDECLARED DISCOVERY THE PACKAGE WAS TRAILERED ORD TO RFD AND WAS DESTINED TO FLY ON UPS AIRCRAFT TO OAK. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2024080023
item.description:
Report E-2024080023

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-07T15:13:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-24
  • City: DAWSONVILLE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 24, 2024, four (4) 5-gallon pails of UN3266 tipped over in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services, Inc. (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew collected the damaged drums in two (2) 55-gallon drums. HES personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to clean up the impacted areas and collected them in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024080005
item.description:
Report E-2024080005

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-07T15:13:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-23
  • City: KENNESAW
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 23, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3266 arrived damaged. As a result, approximately 1/4 gallon of product released to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted trailer. Crews deployed a neutralizing agent to the impacted area, then deployed granular absorbents and worked them in with hand tools. All UN3266 impacted materials and spent absorbents were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-galon drums for disposal.

The package was found Ieaking near the base upon delivery to the gate. This event is under investigation. ,

item.title: Report E-2024070378
item.description:
Report E-2024070378

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-07T15:13:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-04
  • City: CEDARTOWN
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Thursday, July 4th, 2024, at 1057 hours, CSX personnel operating the L81004 observed GATX 5618, a loaded tank car of Sulfuric Acid, in the train, was leaking from the protective housing. The car was held by the CSX train crew on the Main Line at MP SGC 621 outside of Rockmart GA for further investigation. The shipper, GEO Specialty Chemicals Inc, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2024-07-04-00063). Marion Environmental, Inc. (MEI), a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the liquid line closure cap less than tool tight. Contractor personnel tightened the liquid line cap to secure the car. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipperâ€™s representative (Dan Parker, GEO Logistics Manager, 404-782-1699). The car was released for transportation.
